intro: Lasiandra argentea, commonly known as silverleaf lasiandra, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Lasiandra argentea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
